basics.name: Jacob Tutt
basics.label: PhD Candidate | 21-cm Cosmologist | Bayesian Machine Learning Researcher
basics.summary: Astrophysics PhD candidate at the University of Cambridge, specialising in Bayesian inference, machine learning, and high-performance computing for large-scale astronomical data. Research focuses on scalable statistical and computational pipelines for precision cosmology, particularly using redshifted 21-cm observations in the Exascale Era of Radio Astronomy.

work.name: Cavendish Astrophysics Group, University of Cambridge
work.summary: Research focused on developing advanced Bayesian machine learning pipelines for radio cosmology, targeting real-time analysis of data from next-generation radio facilities such as the SKA.
highlights: Developing real-time inference tools for detecting faint cosmological signals
Integrating scalable machine learning methods with high-performance computing frameworks

education.description: Specialised in statistical analysis, deep learning, and scalable computing for astronomical big data. MPhil research project focused on chemo-dynamical clustering of the Milky Way's stellar populations using unsupervised machine learning on data from Gaia, APOGEE, and GALAH.

projects: Sun’s Gravitational Effects on the Earth-Moon Lagrange Points
Future Trajectories of Near-Earth Objects from Short Observation Arcs
Investigating Dark Matter in Galaxy M81 via Mass-to-Light Ratios
